title: Macron warns against complacency after Trump revives 10 percent global tariff
description: French president says Paris will “look precisely at the consequences” after Washington swiftly reintroduced tariffs following a Supreme Court setback.

title: EU’s €90B plan to fund Ukraine in jeopardy as Hungary blocks deal
description: Budapest is fuelling anti-Ukraine sentiment ahead of a key election.

title: Palestinian Authority in dire straits as Israel's hold on West Bank deepens
description: More than 30 years after its creation, there are increasing warnings that the PA is close to collapse.

title: Israeli strikes kill at least 10 in Lebanon, officials say
description: The strikes are among the deadliest in Lebanon since a ceasefire ended the war between Israel and Hezbollah.

title: Family of Palestinian-American man killed in West Bank demand accountability
description: Nasrallah Abu Siyam was the sixth American citizen killed by Israeli settlers or soldiers in the West Bank in the last two years.

title: Trump says he is considering limited military strike on Iran
description: Trump's new threat came a day after he appeared to give Iran about 10 days to agree to a deal to curb its nuclear programme.

title: Italian toddler dies after transplant with heart 'burned by frostbite'
description: The heart given to two-year-old Domenico was reportedly severely damaged during its transfer to hospital.

title: Farmers in Gaza risk Israeli bullets to bring their fields back to life
description: Gaza farmers face risks as Israeli buffer zones expand into their agricultural lands under heavy military control.

description: Israel’s military has carried out air attacks on eastern Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley and refugee camp Ein el-Hilweh.

title: Protesters shoot fireworks at Albania prime minister’s office
description: Police confronted protesters in Albania’s capital Tirana after demonstrators shot fireworks and threw petrol bombs.

title: Trump to make three-day visit to China next month, White House says
description: Three-day trip, at Beijings invitation, comes more than eight years after Trumps first visit to China.

title: Floreana giant tortoise reintroduced to Galápagos island after almost 200 years

title: Bolivia’s ex-leader Evo Morales reappears after months-long unexplained absence

title: Leftist who defended child marriage elected as Peru’s interim president
description: José María Balcázar, who argued for marriage at 14 and above, replaces José Jerí who was voted out after a scandalPeru’s congress has elected José María Balcázar, an octogenarian leftist lawmaker who has defended child marriage, as the country’s interim president ahead of general elections in April.

title: Zelensky Says Ukraine ‘Not Losing’ War As WSJ Correspondent Reports Three-Year Planning Directive
description: Amid stalled talks and internal divisions over how to approach a potential deal, Ukraine’s leadership is weighing the costs of compromise against the risks of a prolonged war.

title: Iskander Missile Plant Hit in Strike Deep Inside Russia’s Udmurtia
description: Russia’s Votkinsk Plant in Udmurtia, which produces Iskander-M missiles, was hit overnight, regional authorities confirmed, with damage reported and flights suspended at Izhevsk airport.

title: ‘Stab in the back’: Open Letter Demands European Venue Drop Pianist over Russia Links
description: Pro-Ukrainian activists urge the Netherlands to cancel pianist Elisabeth Leonskaja’s Feb. 22 concert after her Moscow performance with a Putin ally, days before Russia’s invasion anniversary.

title: Concorde Capital Launches First of Eight Gas-Piston Units in 60 MW Energy Network
description: Concorde Capital, owned by Ukrainian investment banker Igor Mazepa, launched the first stage of its gas-piston power plants project with a total capacity of 60 MW by 2027.

title: Orbán Threatens to Veto €90 Billion EU Loan to Ukraine Over Damaged Russian Oil Pipeline
description: Budapest said it would block the loan until transit resumes through Russia’s Druzhba pipeline, which Kyiv recently said had been damaged by a Russian missile attack on western Ukraine.

description: Controversial Pastor Doug Wilson's theological and historical views, particularly on gender roles and slavery, have long drawn scrutiny and criticism.

title: How commercial drones make the Pentagon’s ‘Blue UAS Select’ list
description: For an off-the-shelf drone to be added to the Blue UAS list, it must pass rigorous testing and cyber security evaluations.

title: Gisèle Pelicot Survived Mass Rape. Now She’s Looking to the Future.
description: Gisèle Pelicot stayed silent after dozens of men were convicted of raping her. Now, Ms. Pelicot is finding peace by publicizing her ordeal and explaining how she survived it.

title: World News in Brief: UN humanitarian chief visits South Sudan, shelter fire risks in Gaza, West Bank
description: The UN Emergency Relief Coordinator arrived in South Sudan on Friday to visit one of the most under-reported humanitarian crises in the world, as clashes between government and opposition forces continue in Jonglei state.

title: UNICEF calls for release of children detained during Iran protests
description: The UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) has called for the immediate release of all children detained during the recent public unrest in Iran, expressing deep concern that minors arrested in connection with the protests remain behind bars.

description: The UN World Food Programme (WFP) is scaling up its emergency response in South Sudan’s Jonglei state, where escalating conflict has displaced hundreds of thousands of people and pushed hunger to critical levels.
